de.ralleytn.simple.audio

Interface Audio

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Playable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAudio, BufferedAudio, StreamedAudio

    public interface Audio
extends Playable
    Interface containing all the methods a good audio implementation should have.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Ralph Niemitz/RalleYTN(ralph.niemitz@gmx.de)

      • getPorts

        static javax.sound.sampled.Mixer.Info[] getPorts()
        Obtains an array of mixer info objects that represents the set of audio mixers that are currently installed on the system.
        Returns:
        an array of info objects for the currently installed mixers. If no mixers are available on the system, an array of length 0 is returned
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getDefaultAudioFormat

        static javax.sound.sampled.AudioFormat getDefaultAudioFormat()
        Returns:
        The default audio format used in the Java Sound API
        Since:
        1.2.2

      • getAudioInputStream

        static javax.sound.sampled.AudioInputStream getAudioInputStream(java.net.URL resource)
                                                         throws AudioException
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the AudioInputStream from the resource
        Throws:
        AudioException - if something went wrong while retrieving the AudioInputStream
        Since:
        1.1.0

      • generateSound

        static void generateSound(int hz,
                          int msecs,
                          int volume,
                          boolean addHarmonic)
        Generates a single sound
        Parameters:
        hz - the sound's frequency
        msecs - the length of the sound in milliseconds
        volume - the volume of the sound (0 - 100)
        addHarmonic - adds a sinus curve to the sound
        Since:
        1.0.0
